<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_snc_plant_mgmt_plant_diseases"> <x_snc_plant_mgmt_plant_diseases action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <common_name>Phytophthora root and crown rot</common_name> <description>How does Phytophthora root (Phytophthora ssp) occur? Crown rot happens when Phytophthora pathogens infect the roots and crown of vulnerable plants. These pathogens release zoospores that can swim in water. When the soil becomes saturated, the zoospores are attracted to plant roots and invade them. They then gradually move upward, infecting the root crown and lower trunk. The fungi target the inner bark, causing the death of inner bark and browning of the outer sapwood layer. This leads to plant decline or death.
</description> <family/> <host>walnut,</host> <number>PLD0001014</number> <scientific_name>Phytophthora spp.</scientific_name> <solution>Fungicide Application Metalaxyl/Mefenoxam and Fosetyl-Aluminum Systemic fungicides provide control against Phytophthora species, and Products based on phosphorous acid and Dimethomorph fungicides with protective and curative properties are being used against this fungus. Consult local agricultural resources for specific recommendations and follow label instructions for proper use.
</solution> <sys_class_name>x_snc_plant_mgmt_plant_diseases</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2024-10-21 23:05:49</sys_created_on> <sys_id>272d160f975112109790fefce053af9d</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2024-10-21 23:05:49</sys_updated_on> </x_snc_plant_mgmt_plant_diseases> </record_update>
